name: Hester Lawrence
reviewText: I don't mind flipping the twinloc and i expect most racers are in the same spirit. I've had electronic suspensions and high anti squat bike in the past and the low anti squat with twinloc had the best overall experience by a good margin.

name: Patterson Mcdonald
reviewText: The twinloc becomes second nature very quickly, nothing like as annoying as I'd thought it would be.

name: Olga Mullen
reviewText: The 67.1 degree head angle is the steep position. Rotating the cups slackens it by 1.2 degrees. That is to 65.9 degrees. I know, I've had mine in both settings and prefer the slacker. Almost every review of this bike has got this detail wrong.

name: Watts Christensen
reviewText: reviews across the interweb havent been overly kind to the Spark, seems the old bike would be a wise choice whilst everybody drools over this model and its svelte lines.

name: Catherine Fuller
reviewText: I'm not an xc dropper post drum-banger, but curious if the shock location mandates an AXS dropper. How would a cable snake past the internal shock?Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. Quaerat, nam.

name: Ladonna Massey
reviewText: Scott mounts its shocks upside-down, so the air can is down near the BB and there's more than enough room for a dropper cable.
